com.gmail.at.kevinburnseit.rxtable

Class RxTableWithAddedRecords

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JTable
            • com.gmail.at.kevinburnseit.rxtable.RXTable
              • com.gmail.at.kevinburnseit.rxtable.RxTableWithAddedRecords
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.event.CellEditorListener, javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener, javax.swing.event.RowSorterListener, javax.swing.event.TableColumnModelListener, javax.swing.event.TableModelListener, javax.swing.Scrollable

    public class RxTableWithAddedRecords
extends RXTable
    A further extension of Rob Camick's RXTable, the source of which is available here. This class includes Mr. Camick's modifications, as well as the following additional features:
    • Provides a context menu for the user to add a new record or to delete an existing record
    • The context menu provided for these purposes can be fetched for adding more menu items, if desired.
    • Allows the user to register a menu item listener which will be notified with every popup menu invoke event. This listener will determine whether the menu item should be enabled.
    • Allows other code to register a scroll pane which contains this table, so that the popup menu will appear when the user right-clicks outside the table.
    • Adds accessibility support
    • Allows external functions to listen for start-edit/end-edit events
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Kevin J. Burns
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getRecordInvokingLastPopup

        public int getRecordInvokingLastPopup()
        Returns the row that was clicked last time the user invoked the popup menu. If the user clicked in the table's scroll pane, if one was registered using setScrollPane(JScrollPane), this function will return -1.
        Returns:

      • registerMenuItemListener

                                     RxTableWithAddedRecords.MenuItemEnableListener l)
        Notifies this table that notice is required to an external popup menu item when the popup is invoked. The listener will determine whether the item should be enabled when displayed to the user
        Parameters:

        l - the listener to be notified

      • getRowClicked

        public int getRowClicked()
        Returns the row which was clicked last time the user invoked the popup menu, if known. If the right-click occurred somewhere other than a table record (in the scroll pane, for example), or if the table has intentionally forgotten which row was clicked last time, -1 is returned.
        Returns:

      • setSelection

        void setSelection(int record)
        Sets the table's selection interval to be equal to the specified record.
        Parameters:
        record - The record to be selected, or -1 to select none.

      • getAffectedRow

        public int getAffectedRow()
        For a record manipulation action which could be performed on this table, this function fetches the record number which would be affected by such an action. First, it looks to see if a popup invocation is remembered; if so, it returns that record number. Otherwise, it returns the record number which is currently selected. If there is no record selected, the function returns -1.
        Returns:
